title: Martian Terraforming Hub Adventure #48
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Terraforming Control Center
rooms.description: A high-tech command center with holographic displays showing Mars atmospheric data. Red dust covers some of the equipment. Through the reinforced windows, you see the rust-colored Martian landscape stretching to the horizon. Warning lights blink on several consoles.

items.name: main control console
items.description: A large console with multiple compartments and displays showing terraforming progress

items.name: mission log datapad
items.description: A digital log with recent entries from the station commander
items.text: Mission Log - Commander Sarah Chen: The terraforming project began in 2087. Dr. Marcus Webb leads the atmospheric research team. Remember: oxygen levels are stored in the research lab database, and the emergency shuttle requires proper authorization.

items.name: security access keycard
items.description: A magnetic keycard labeled 'Research Lab Access - Level 3'

items.name: atmospheric monitoring display
items.description: A screen showing current Mars atmospheric composition data
items.text: Current Atmospheric Composition: Oxygen: 15%, Nitrogen: 78%, CO2: 7%. Target oxygen level for human habitation: 21%. Project lead: Dr. Marcus Webb.

items.name: equipment storage locker
items.description: A tall metal locker containing various tools and supplies

items.name: maintenance reminder
items.description: A handwritten note stuck to a clipboard
items.text: Reminder: Vault combination is the target oxygen percentage followed by the current oxygen percentage. Don't forget! - Engineering Team

items.name: research lab door
items.description: A sealed door with a card reader leading to the research laboratory

rooms.name: Atmospheric Research Laboratory
rooms.description: A pristine laboratory filled with scientific equipment, sample containers, and analysis stations. Holographic models of Mars float above workstations. The walls are lined with research notes and data charts. A large vault door dominates the north wall.

items.name: lead researcher's desk
items.description: A desk covered with papers, data tablets, and personal items

items.name: personnel identification file
items.description: A file containing staff information and photos
items.text: PERSONNEL FILE - Station Commander: Sarah Chen, Chief Scientist: Dr. Marcus Webb, Lead Engineer: James Rodriguez. Emergency Protocol: Commander authorization required for shuttle bay access.

items.name: laboratory cabinet
items.description: A secure cabinet with multiple drawers for storing sensitive materials

items.name: research summary report
items.description: A detailed report on the terraforming progress
items.text: Terraforming Progress Report: We have successfully raised oxygen levels from initial 0% to current 15%. Target remains 21% for full human habitation. The biolab safe combination is target oxygen (21) followed by current oxygen (15).

items.name: shuttle authorization codes
items.description: A document containing emergency shuttle access information
items.text: EMERGENCY SHUTTLE AUTHORIZATION: Access requires answering security questions. Authorized personnel only. Questions verify: Who commands this station? Who leads the science team? What is our mission location?

items.name: sample analysis station
items.description: A workstation with various Martian soil and atmosphere samples
items.text: Sample Analysis Notes: All samples collected from Mars surface. Primary mission: terraform Mars for human colonization. Station location: Mars Terraforming Hub Alpha.

items.name: shuttle bay vault door
items.description: A massive reinforced door with a security terminal. Three authentication questions are displayed on the screen.

password_questions.question: Who is the station commander?
password_questions.hint: Check the mission log and personnel files

password_questions.question: Who is the chief scientist?
password_questions.hint: Look at the personnel file and atmospheric displays

password_questions.question: What planet are we terraforming?
password_questions.hint: Read the sample analysis notes and look around

rooms.name: Emergency Shuttle Bay
rooms.description: You've reached the shuttle bay! A sleek emergency shuttle sits on the launch pad, its engines humming with power. Through the massive bay doors, you can see Earth as a blue dot in the black sky. The shuttle's boarding ramp is extended and ready. Freedom awaits!

items.name: emergency escape shuttle
items.description: A state-of-the-art spacecraft designed for rapid evacuation, fueled and ready for launch

items.name: shuttle launch console
items.description: A control panel showing all systems green and ready for departure

items.name: observation window
items.description: A large window showing the Martian landscape and the distant Earth

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You board the emergency shuttle and initiate the launch sequence. The engines roar to life as the shuttle lifts off from the Martian surface. You watch through the window as the red planet grows smaller below you. You're heading home to Earth with valuable data about the terraforming project. Mission accomplished! You win!
